translation:
You can bake the bone deformation information of a model during motion playback and output any history of deformation information as a motion.
There are no restrictions on which bones can be baked.
To allow MMD to read the baked result, bone names related to physics in the model will be prefixed and added to the display frame.

You can additionally load multi-person motions or models for rigid bodies.
By adding settings, you can switch the target models or motions for baking.
Load baking settings saved separately in JSON.

Save the current baking settings in JSON.
Next time, you can restore them by loading the saved JSON.
Stops both motion playback and baking simultaneously.

Starts both motion playback and baking simultaneously.
The baked motion result can be played back in the "Baked Viewer."
Set the downward gravity for physics simulation.

id: 焼き込み後モーション(Vmd)
焼き込み後モーション説明
translation: You can set the output destination of the baked motion result.

You can set the output destination of the modified model with adjusted bone names for baking.
In the modified model, bones with baking prefixes are added to the display frame.
You can set the motion to be baked.
You can set the model to be baked.

id: ファイル選択ダイアログタイトル
ファイル選択ダイアログ選択エラー
translation: Failed to select a file in the file selection dialog.

Save the model adjusted for baking.
Bone names for baking are given prefixes so the physics results can be read in MMD.
Save the specified range of motion from the selected baking history INDEX as a Vmd file.

id: ワールド物理設定テーブル
ワールド物理設定テーブル説明
translation:
Configure the physics options for physics baking.
These options can also be modified and applied during baking playback.

id: モデル物理設定テーブル
モデル物理設定テーブル説明
translation:
You can configure rigid body options for physics baking.
These options can also be modified and applied during baking playback.

You can configure wind options for physics baking.
These options can also be modified and applied during baking playback.

id: 出力開始フレーム説明
translation: You can set the start frame for saving the baked result.

id: 出力終了フレーム説明
translation: You can set the end frame for saving the baked result.

id: リセットフレーム説明
translation:
By setting a negative value, the physics will reset during baking playback when the timeline reaches the specified number of frames before the output start frame.
If the reset frame is 0, no physics reset will occur.

id: 焼き込み設定変更エラー

translation:
Register the current baking settings.
After registration, when you output a motion, baking will be performed with the registered settings.
If multiple settings are registered for the same frame, the lower setting takes priority.
Delete the currently selected baking settings.
Cancel the changes to the current baking settings.

You can select the baking history INDEX recorded during baking playback.
The history INDEX is automatically added during baking playback.
When you change the history INDEX, the corresponding history is displayed in the "Baked Viewer."
In this state, pressing the "Save Baked Motion" button will save the motion of the selected history according to the settings in the "Output Settings Table."

id: 焼き込みセットの元モデルまたは出力モーションが設定されていません
translation: The source model or output motion of the baking set has not been set.

id: 開始フレームより終了フレームが小さいか、負の値が設定されています
translation: The end frame is smaller than the start frame, or a negative value has been set.

Set the multiplier for rigid body mass.
The larger the value, the heavier the rigid body becomes and the slower it moves.
Specifically, the current mass of each rigid body is multiplied by the specified multiplier.
It applies only to the selected bones and their child bones in the bone tree view below.

Set the multiplier for joint stiffness.
The larger the value, the stiffer the joint becomes, making it harder to deform.
Specifically, the current rotation limit of each joint is multiplied by the specified multiplier.
It applies only to the selected bones and their child bones in the bone tree view below.

Set the multiplier for springiness.
The larger the value, the stronger the spring becomes, making deformation harder.
Specifically, the current spring value of each joint is multiplied by the specified multiplier.
It applies only to the selected bones and their child bones in the bone tree view below.

id: %s (大きさ倍率: [%s], 質量: %.2f, 硬さ: %.2f, 張り: %.2f)

translation:
You can set Bullet's MaxSubSteps.
To increase the accuracy of physics calculations, multiple simulations are performed per frame.
The larger the value, the higher the accuracy, but processing time also increases.

You can set Bullet's FixedTimeStep.
This changes the execution frequency of physics calculations within one frame.
The larger the value, the more frequently physics is calculated and the higher the accuracy, but processing time also increases.

Set whether IK-related bones in the output bone tree are targeted for baking.
Specifically, IK bones, IK link bones, and IK target bones are included.
If enabled, the positions and rotations of IK-related bones will be baked into the output motion.

id: 物理焼き込み対象説明
translation:
Set whether physics bones in the output bone tree are targeted for baking.
If enabled, the positions and rotations of physics bones will be baked into the output motion.

id: 準標準焼き込み対象説明
translation:
Set whether semi-standard bones in the output bone tree, excluding all parents, leg D, and fingers, are targeted for baking.
If enabled, the positions and rotations of semi-standard bones, taking into account adjustment (additional parent) bones, will be baked into the output motion.

Set whether semi-standard finger bones in the output bone tree are targeted for baking.
If enabled, the positions and rotations of finger bones, considering adjustment (additional parent) bones and grasp/spread, will be baked into the output motion.

id: キーフレーム数が上限を超えるため、モーションを切り替えます[%04dF]: %d -> %d
translation: The number of keyframes exceeds the limit, switching motion [%04dF]: %d -> %d

id: - 物理焼き込み中... [%04dF] %dキーフレーム
物理焼き込みセット保存失敗エラー
translation: Failed to save physics baking set settings JSON.

id: 物理焼き込みセット保存成功
translation: Successfully saved physics baking set settings JSON.

id: 物理焼き込みセット読込失敗エラー
translation: Failed to load physics baking set settings JSON.

id: 物理焼き込みセット読込成功
translation: Successfully loaded physics baking set settings JSON.

id: 出力ボーンツリー設定失敗エラー
translation: Failed to initialize output bone tree.

id: 物理ボーンツリー設定失敗エラー
translation: Failed to initialize physics bone tree.

id: 元モーションのコピーに失敗しました: %w
焼き込み対象ボーン名
焼き込み対象キーフレームなし
translation:
No target keyframes could be extracted for baking.
It is possible that baking target bones or the baking range were not set in the output settings table.

id: 出力設定テーブル説明
translation:
The output settings table is used to set bones and frame ranges for baking.
You can configure baking target bones and frame ranges.
Double-clicking a row in the table will open the baking settings dialog.
The contents set in the baking settings dialog will be reflected in the table when the Register button is pressed.
After registration, when you output a motion, baking will be performed with the registered settings.
If multiple settings are registered for the same frame, the lower setting takes priority.

Baking is a function for adjusting the behavior of physics simulations and the physics settings of rigid bodies and joints targeted for baking.
1. Double-click a row in the "World Physics Settings Table" to open the physics settings options dialog.
2. By adjusting settings in the physics options dialog, you can control the behavior of the physics.
3. Saving physics settings with the Register button in the physics options dialog will change the behavior.

Physics adjustments can also be made during baking playback.
The meaning of each parameter can be checked in the tooltips of parameter names in the dialog.

id: 焼き込み結果の確認説明
translation:
Check baking results by displaying the outcome of baking playback in the "Baked Viewer."
When baking playback is performed, baking history is recorded.
The baking history INDEX is automatically added during baking playback.
Changing the baking history INDEX allows you to view the baked motion result of the selected history in the "Baked Viewer."

id: 焼き込み結果の保存説明
translation:
This function saves the motion of the baking history selected in the "Baked Viewer."
1. Change the "Baking History INDEX" to select the history you want to save.
2. Double-click a row in the "Output Settings Table" to open the baking settings dialog.
3. In the baking settings dialog, set the bones and frame range you actually want to bake.
4. Click the "Register" button in the baking settings dialog to save the baking settings.
5. Press the "Save Baked Motion" button to save the motion of the selected history according to the settings in the "Output Settings Table."
   The save destination will be the path set in Baked Motion (Vmd) + the motion start frame.
6. Be sure to also perform "Save Baking Model" to adjust bone names, etc., so the baked results can be applied.

id: 焼き込み履歴クリア説明
translation:
Clears all baking history of the currently selected baking set.
All history recorded during baking playback will also be deleted.
If there is too much history, the performance of baking playback may deteriorate, so it is recommended to clear it regularly.

Sets the change start frame when treating the physics settings as a trapezoid.
Applies only to the selected rigid bodies and their child rigid bodies in the rigid body tree view below.

Sets the change end frame when treating the physics settings as a trapezoid.
Applies only to the selected rigid bodies and their child rigid bodies in the rigid body tree view below.

Set the multiplier for the rigid body size X.
Sphere ... radius, Box ... width, Capsule ... radius
The larger the value, the larger the rigid body's size X becomes.
Specifically, the current size X of each rigid body is multiplied by the specified multiplier.
Applies only to the selected bones and their child bones in the bone tree view below.

Set the multiplier for the rigid body size Y.
Sphere ... N/A, Box ... height, Capsule ... height
The larger the value, the larger the rigid body's size Y becomes.
Specifically, the current size Y of each rigid body is multiplied by the specified multiplier.
Applies only to the selected bones and their child bones in the bone tree view below.

Set the multiplier for the rigid body size Z.
Sphere ... N/A, Box ... depth, Capsule ... N/A
The larger the value, the larger the rigid body's size Z becomes.
Specifically, the current size Z of each rigid body is multiplied by the specified multiplier.
Applies only to the selected bones and their child bones in the bone tree view below.

id: 焼き込み物理適用説明
translation:
Applies the current settings of the World Physics Settings Table to the model of the currently selected baking set.
Physics settings changed in the World Physics Settings Table are reflected in the adjusted model and can be saved.
Changes to the physics settings table are applied even during baking playback.

When playing a frame where this checkbox is ON, shaping is performed to make the physics simulation cleaner.
Specifically, it transitions gradually from an upright Y-stance.
Continuity with the previous frame is lost, so it is basically recommended to set this only at frame 0.

id: 焼き込み再生開始: 焼き込み履歴INDEX[%d]
translation: Start Baking Playback: Baking History INDEX[%d]

id: 最大開始フレーム説明
translation:
Sets the maximum start frame when treating the model physics settings as a trapezoid.
Applies only to the selected rigid bodies and their child rigid bodies in the rigid body tree view below.

id: 最大終了フレーム説明
translation:
Sets the maximum end frame when treating the model physics settings as a trapezoid.
Applies only to the selected rigid bodies and their child rigid bodies in the rigid body tree view below.

id: ワールド物理設定追加
ワールド物理設定追加説明
translation: Add a world physics modification setting.

id: モデル物理設定追加説明
translation: Add a rigid body modification setting for the model.
Add a world wind modification setting.
Add an output target setting for the model.

id: 物理設定キャンセル説明
モデル物理設定レコードがありません
translation: No model physics setting records found

id: モデル物理範囲設定エラー
translation: The frame range for model physics must satisfy: Start Frame < Maximum Start Frame < Maximum End Frame < End Frame.

id: ワールド物理範囲設定エラー
translation: The frame range for world physics must satisfy: Start Frame < End Frame.
The frame range for output settings must satisfy: Start Frame < End Frame.

id: ワールド物理の調整説明
translation:
Adjust the physics settings of the world (the space where models are loaded).
The current settings of the World Physics Settings Table are applied to the world.
Changes made in the World Physics Settings Table are reflected in the world and can be saved to JSON.
Modifications in the World Physics Settings Table are applied even during baking playback.

id: モデル物理の調整説明
translation:
Adjust the physics settings of the model.
You can temporarily enlarge rigid bodies or change joint stiffness.
The current settings of the Model Physics Settings Table are applied to the model.
Changes made in the Model Physics Settings Table are reflected in the model and can be saved to JSON.
Modifications in the Model Physics Settings Table are applied even during baking playback.
If not playing back, rigid body updates may not work correctly, but playback should apply them as specified.

Adjust the physics settings of wind.
You can apply simulated wind results to rigid bodies.
The current settings of the Wind Physics Settings Table are applied to the rigid bodies.
Changes made in the Wind Physics Settings Table are reflected in the model and can be saved to JSON.
Modifications in the Wind Physics Settings Table are applied even during baking playback.

Pressing the "Baking Playback" button plays back the current motion with baking.
To stabilize the behavior of the physics, playback starts by gradually transitioning from a Y-stance (arms raised diagonally upward) to the initial frame pose.
Even during baking playback, parameters in the World Physics Settings Table and Model Physics Settings Table can be modified and applied.
Pressing the "Stop Baking" button during playback stops baking playback.
When playback reaches the end, it automatically loops.

id: 焼き込み履歴INDEXの選択説明
translation:
When played with the "Baking Playback" button, the motion including the physics shown in the "Viewer" window is internally saved as baking history.
By changing the Baking History INDEX, you can switch and check the baking history displayed in the "Baked Viewer."
When playback finishes and loops back to 0F, or when resuming after stopping baking, the Baking History INDEX is updated.

id: 焼き込み結果の出力説明
translation:
The baking results selected by "Baking History INDEX" and displayed in the "Baked Viewer" can be exported as a VMD motion.
The bones selected in the Output Settings Table will be exported, along with other keyframes registered in the original motion.
The contents of the Output Settings Table can be saved to JSON.
To support the VMD bone name length limit, physics bones are prefixed.
Therefore, when loading physics baking results in MMD, be sure to also perform "Save Baking Model" with adjusted bone names.
Normal bones output values that take into account adjustment bones including additional parents.

id: 出力対象ボーンが見つからなかったため、出力設定をスキップします [No.%02d]
translation: No output target bones found, skipping output setting [No.%02d]

id: --- キーフレーム焼き込み処理中 [%s][%04d][%d] ...
モーション保存完了: 処理時間 %s
出力対象ボーンが見つからなかったため、出力設定をスキップします [No.%02d]
translation: No output target bones found, skipping output setting [No.%02d]

id: 物理焼き込みセットの元モデルが設定されていません
translation: The source model of the physics baking set has not been set

id: 物理焼き込みセットの元モーションが設定されていません
translation: The source motion of the physics baking set has not been set

id: 物理焼き込みセットの出力モーションパスが設定されていません
translation: The output motion path of the physics baking set has not been set

id: 物理焼き込みセットの出力モーションが設定されていません
translation: The output motion of the physics baking set has not been set

id: 物理焼き込みセットの出力レコードが設定されていません
translation: The output record of the physics baking set has not been set

You can set the change in the rigid body's global position X.
Sphere ... radius, Box ... width, Capsule ... radius
The larger the value, the more the rigid body moves in the X direction.
Applies only to the bones selected in the bone tree view below.

You can set the change in the rigid body's global position Y.
Sphere ... N/A, Box ... height, Capsule ... height
The larger the value, the more the rigid body moves in the Y direction.
Applies only to the bones selected in the bone tree view below.

You can set the change in the rigid body's global position Z.
Sphere ... N/A, Box ... depth, Capsule ... N/A
The larger the value, the more the rigid body moves in the Z direction.
Applies only to the bones selected in the bone tree view below.

You can set the direction of the wind.
The wind direction is represented as a vector along the X, Y, and Z axes.

You can set the strength of the wind.
The larger the value, the stronger the wind effect.

Adds random variation to wind strength.
The larger the value, the greater the fluctuation in wind strength.

You can set the frequency of wind turbulence.
The larger the value, the stronger the wind disturbance.

You can set the drag coefficient of wind on rigid bodies.
The larger the value, the more the rigid body is affected by the wind.

You can set the lift coefficient of wind on rigid bodies.
The larger the value, the stronger the lifting effect of the wind.
